intro: Unonopsis bahiensis, commonly known as the Bahia dandelion, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features a basal rosette of leaves and produces yellow flowers that develop into fluffy seed heads. It thrives in dry, open habitats and is often found in disturbed soils. Unonopsis bahiensis is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been introduced to other regions for horticultural purposes.
